sentences.sContent: Emperor Akihito of Japan has been enthroned in Tokyo.
sentences.sCn: 日皇明仁已在东京登基。

sentences.sContent: He is expected to be enthroned early next year as the spiritual leader.
sentences.sCn: 人们预计他将于明年初作为精神领袖登位。

synos.tran: 使登基；立…为王；任为主教；崇拜

remMethod.val: en (使…) + throne (宝座) → 使登上宝座 → 登基

words.tran: 即位；登基典礼，就任主教的仪式
授予主教职位；登基典礼（等于enthronement）

trans.tranCn: 使登基； 崇拜， 尊崇
trans.tranOther: When kings, queens, emperors, or bishops are enthroned, they officially take on their role during a special ceremony
